explains: adj. 整洁的，崭新的；未受损害的，处于原始状态的；正派的，正直的

sentences.en: Now elsewhere in the world, Iceland may be spoken of, somewhat breathlessly, as western Europe's last pristine wilderness.
sentences.cn: 现在在世界其他地方，可能说起冰岛，人们会有些喘不过气来，说它是西欧最后的原始荒野。

sentences.en: He collected pristine samples of the meteorite just days after they fell on the frozen lake, and stored them in his freezer.
sentences.cn: 几天后，他收集了落在冰冻湖面的陨石的原始样本，并把它们储存在他的冰箱里。

sentences.en: What do a peckish bee-eater, two shaggy bisons going head-to-head in snow, and pelicans dancing in a pristine lake all have in common?
sentences.cn: 一只饥肠辘辘的食蜂鸟，两头在雪地里相互抵角的长毛野牛，以及在一片原始湖泊中翩翩起舞的鹈鹕们，它们有什么共同点吗？
